alert.note: Alert for Covington; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 18 at 6:31AM CDT until March 18 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN COVINGTON AND JONES COUNTIES... At 631 AM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding has been reported in and around Laurel in Jones County. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Laurel, Ellisville, Sandersville, Moselle, Tuckers Crossing, Eastabuchie, Hebron, Ovett, Sanford, Mill Creek and Seminary. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
